items.title: Gov Newsom says Trump is sending California National Guard troops to Oregon
items.standfirst: The deployment would mark the latest escalation of Donald Trump’s use of US federal intervention in Democrat-led cities.
items.content: The deployment would mark the latest escalation of Donald Trump’s use of US federal intervention in Democrat-led cities.

items.title: US Judge temporarily blocks Trump administration from deploying troops in Portland
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump authorized deployment of troops to Chicago after a federal agent shot an allegedly armed motorist there on Saturday, while a judge blocked the Republican leader's attempt to send the military into Portland, another Democratic-run city. The escalating crisis across the country pits Trump's increasingly militarized anti-crime and migration crackdown against opposition Democrats who accuse him of an authoritarian power grab. FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert tells us more.
items.content: US President Donald Trump authorized deployment of troops to Chicago after a federal agent shot an allegedly armed motorist there on Saturday, while a judge blocked the Republican leader's attempt to send the military into Portland, another Democratic-run city. The escalating crisis across the country pits Trump's increasingly militarized anti-crime and migration crackdown against opposition Democrats who accuse him of an authoritarian power grab. FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert tells us more.

ai_summary: A federal judge temporarily blocked the Trump administration from sending National Guard troops to Oregon.
The judge's order came after Trump sent California troops to Portland, Oregon.
The order prevents the deployment of National Guard troops from other states to Oregon.
California joined Oregon's lawsuit challenging the Trump administration's actions.
Governor Newsom said Trump is sending 300 California National Guardsmen to Oregon.

clusters.title: Snowstorm traps hundreds of hikers on Mount Everest during China's national holiday

Reported by NPR News, NBC World, Guardian World and others

items.title: Snowstorm traps hundreds of hikers on Mount Everest during China's national holiday
items.standfirst: Rescue workers were helping hundreds of hikers trapped by heavy snow at tourist campsites on a slope of Mount Everest in Tibet, Chinese state media said late Sunday.
items.content: Rescue workers were helping hundreds of hikers trapped by heavy snow at tourist campsites on a slope of Mount Everest in Tibet, Chinese state media said late Sunday.(Image credit: Jigme Dorje)

items.title: Hundreds trapped by blizzard conditions on Mount Everest
items.standfirst: Rescue efforts were underway on Sunday on Tibet’s eastern slope of Mount Everest, where nearly 1,000 people were trapped by a blizzard, according to Chinese state media reports. NBC News’ Camila Bernal has the latest.
items.content: Rescue efforts were underway on Sunday on Tibet’s eastern slope of Mount Everest, where nearly 1,000 people were trapped by a blizzard, according to Chinese state media reports. NBC News’ Camila Bernal has the latest.

items.title: Mount Everest rescue under way after snowstorm traps nearly 1,000 people
items.standfirst: Hundreds of trekkers stranded by blizzard on eastern face of mountain in Tibet already guided to safety by rescuersRescue efforts are under way on Mount Everest after a snowstorm trapped nearly 1,000 people in campsites on the eastern side of the mountain, according to Chinese state media.Hundreds of trekkers stranded by a blizzard near the eastern face of the mountain in Tibet were guided to safety by rescuers on Sunday, as unusually heavy precipitation including rain pummelled the Himalayas. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Democrats, Republicans remain deadlocked as US government shutdown enters sixth day
clusters.neutral_headline: US Government Shutdown Enters Sixth Day
bullet_summary: A CBS poll found just 28% of Democratic voters and 23% of Republicans consider their party’s positions worth shutting down the government
Reported by France24, Reuters Top News, Al Jazeera and others

items.title: Democrats, Republicans remain deadlocked as US government shutdown enters sixth day
items.standfirst: Republican and Democratic lawmakers remained deadlocked on Sunday over how to reopen the federal government – with US President Donald Trump claiming job cuts were already under way as both sides accused each other of stalling talks. The standoff comes amid mounting economic uncertainty.
items.content: Republican and Democratic lawmakers remained deadlocked on Sunday over how to reopen the federal government – with US President Donald Trump claiming job cuts were already under way as both sides accused each other of stalling talks. The standoff comes amid mounting economic uncertainty.

items.title: Government shutdown entering sixth day as Republicans and Democrats remain at an impasse
White House threatens mass layoffs amid deepening US government shutdown
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump blames Democrats for looming federal layoffs as shutdown enters fifth day.
items.content: US President Donald Trump blames Democrats for looming federal layoffs as shutdown enters fifth day.

items.title: House speaker says Democrats aren’t serious about shutdown negotiation as Democratic leader blames Republicans
items.standfirst: Mike Johnson adds Trump does not want permanent job cuts as talks between parties stalled over weekendThe Republican House speaker, Mike Johnson, accused Democrats of being “not serious” in negotiations to end the federal government shutdown, while the Democratic leader accused Republicans of driving the shutdown, now on its fifth day and expected to last at least through next week.Talks between the opposing political parties stalled over the weekend, with no votes anticipated to end the standoff. A CBS poll found just 28% of Democratic voters and 23% of Republicans consider their party’s positions worth shutting down the government. Continue reading...
items.content: Mike Johnson adds Trump does not want permanent job cuts as talks between parties stalled over weekendThe Republican House speaker, Mike Johnson, accused Democrats of being “not serious” in negotiations to end the federal government shutdown, while the Democratic leader accused Republicans of driving the shutdown, now on its fifth day and expected to last at least through next week.Talks between the opposing political parties stalled over the weekend, with no votes anticipated to end the standoff. A CBS poll found just 28% of Democratic voters and 23% of Republicans consider their party’s positions worth shutting down the government. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Republicans and Democrats remain deadlocked over reopening the government.
The standoff is amid mounting economic uncertainty.
The White House threatens mass layoffs due to the shutdown.
Talks between parties stalled over the weekend.
A CBS poll showed low support for party positions.

clusters.title: War in Gaza live: Israel and Hamas delegations hold talks in Egypt over Trump's Gaza plan
clusters.neutral_headline: Gaza Talks Begin in Cairo Over Trump's Peace Plan
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, Guardian World, NBC World

items.title: War in Gaza live: Israel and Hamas delegations hold talks in Egypt over Trump's Gaza plan
items.standfirst: Israeli and Hamas officials arrived in Cairo on Monday to discuss US President Donald Trump’s peace plan and negotiate a potential deal for the release of hostages held in Gaza. While key details remain uncertain, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has made it clear that a full military withdrawal from Gaza is not on the table. Follow our liveblog for the latest developments.
items.content: Israeli and Hamas officials arrived in Cairo on Monday to discuss US President Donald Trump’s peace plan and negotiate a potential deal for the release of hostages held in Gaza. While key details remain uncertain, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has made it clear that a full military withdrawal from Gaza is not on the table. Follow our liveblog for the latest developments.

items.title: Trump urges negotiators to ‘move fast’ as Gaza ceasefire talks set to begin in Cairo
items.standfirst: Talks on Monday expected to focus on release of hostages and end to war, after Israel kills 63 people in Gaza in past dayDonald Trump has urged negotiators to “move fast” in talks focused on the release of hostages held by Hamas in Gaza and a broader end to the war, as representatives arrived in Cairo for discussions set to begin on Monday.The talks will focus on the first phase of Trump’s plan to end the war in Gaza, the Egyptian foreign ministry said, which is the release of the remaining 48 hostages held by Hamas in return for Palestinian prisoners held in Israel. Continue reading...
items.content: Talks on Monday expected to focus on release of hostages and end to war, after Israel kills 63 people in Gaza in past dayDonald Trump has urged negotiators to “move fast” in talks focused on the release of hostages held by Hamas in Gaza and a broader end to the war, as representatives arrived in Cairo for discussions set to begin on Monday.The talks will focus on the first phase of Trump’s plan to end the war in Gaza, the Egyptian foreign ministry said, which is the release of the remaining 48 hostages held by Hamas in return for Palestinian prisoners held in Israel. items.content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared Israel and Hamas are on the brink of a hostage deal as President Donald Trump’s son-in-law and his Middle East envoy traveled to the region for talks, raising hopes Sunday that the war in Gaza was on the verge of ending

The talks aim to negotiate a deal for the release of hostages.

The talks will focus on the first phase of Trump’s plan.
Netanyahu hopes for a hostage release in the coming days.

items.title: Is Japan About to Get Its First Female Prime Minister?
items.standfirst: Japan could soon make history with its first-ever female prime minister. Hardline conservative Sanae Takaichi has been elected the new leader of Japan's ruling party, putting her on track to lead the world's fourth-biggest economy. Here's what to know about her. ---------- Like this video?…

Here's what to know about her. ---------- Like this video?…

items.title: Who is Japan's 'Iron Lady' Sanae Takaichi?
items.standfirst: The conservative politician, who sees Margaret Thatcher as an inspiration, is set to be Japan's first female prime minister.
items.content: The conservative politician, who sees Margaret Thatcher as an inspiration, is set to be Japan's first female prime minister.

items.title: Japan poised to get first female PM after Sanae Takaichi wins ruling party leadership
items.standfirst: Margaret Thatcher admirer beat her more moderate rival to become leader of Liberal Democratic partyJapan is poised to get its first female prime minister after Sanae Takaichi was elected as leader of the governing Liberal Democratic party (LDP) – a victory that should lead to her being installed as the country’s new leader in the middle of the month.Takaichi, a rightwing politician who has voiced admiration for Margaret Thatcher in her quest to build a “strong and prosperous” Japan on the international stage, beat her moderate rival, Shinjiro Koizumi, in a runoff election at the LDP headquarters in Tokyo on Saturday. Continue reading...
items.content: Margaret Thatcher admirer beat her more moderate rival to become leader of Liberal Democratic partyJapan is poised to get its first female prime minister after Sanae Takaichi was elected as leader of the governing Liberal Democratic party (LDP) – a victory that should lead to her being installed as the country’s new leader in the middle of the month.Takaichi, a rightwing politician who has voiced admiration for Margaret Thatcher in her quest to build a “strong and prosperous” Japan on the international stage, beat her moderate rival, Shinjiro Koizumi, in a runoff election at the LDP headquarters in Tokyo on Saturday. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Sanae Takaichi won the leadership of Japan's ruling party.
She is set to become Japan's first female prime minister.
Takaichi is a conservative politician who admires Margaret Thatcher.
She beat her more moderate rival in a runoff election.
Investors expect more fiscal spending and pressure on the central bank.

clusters.title: Syria holds first elections since fall of Bashar al-Assad
clusters.neutral_headline: Syria Holds First Elections Since Assad's Fall
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, Al Jazeera, France24

items.title: Syria holds first elections since fall of Bashar al-Assad
items.standfirst: After more than a decade of civil war, committee members will choose transitional parliamentSyria is holding its first parliamentary elections since the fall of its longtime ruler Bashar al-Assad, in a tentative step towards democratic polls that have been criticised as biased in favour of the country’s interim leaders.As the battle-ravaged country moves through its post-Assad political transition after more than a decade of civil war, members of local committees are beginning the significant milestone of selecting a transitional parliament. Continue reading...
items.content: After more than a decade of civil war, committee members will choose transitional parliamentSyria is holding its first parliamentary elections since the fall of its longtime ruler Bashar al-Assad, in a tentative step towards democratic polls that have been criticised as biased in favour of the country’s interim leaders.As the battle-ravaged country moves through its post-Assad political transition after more than a decade of civil war, members of local committees are beginning the significant milestone of selecting a transitional parliament. Continue reading...

items.title: Video: Here’s how Syria is electing its first post-Assad parliament
items.standfirst: Syria is holding its first indirect parliamentary election since the ouster of longtime ruler Bashar al-Assad.
items.content: Syria is holding its first indirect parliamentary election since the ouster of longtime ruler Bashar al-Assad.

items.title: Syria to select members of first post-Assad parliament in indirect vote
items.standfirst: Members of local committees in Syria began on Sunday (October 5) selecting members of a transitional parliament, in a process criticised as undemocratic, with a third of the members appointed directly by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa.
items.content: Members of local committees in Syria began on Sunday (October 5) selecting members of a transitional parliament, in a process criticised as undemocratic, with a third of the members appointed directly by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa.

items.title: Syria: In Raqqa, fear of new episode of violence looms
items.standfirst: Syrian electors will select members of its first post-Assad parliament on Sunday (October 5) in a process criticised, with a third of the members appointed by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa. The process is widely expected to consolidate the power of Sharaa and raise more questions about how to unite the country after 13 years of civil war. According to the interim government in Damascus, northeastern Syria has been largely excluded from the electoral process for security reasons. Negotiations are supposed to lead to the integration of this Kurdish-dominated region into the rest of Syria, but in the absence of significant progress, the standoff continues. In Raqqa, Kurdish authorities prepare for any eventuality.
items.content: Syrian electors will select members of its first post-Assad parliament on Sunday (October 5) in a process criticised, with a third of the members appointed by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa. The process is widely expected to consolidate the power of Sharaa and raise more questions about how to unite the country after 13 years of civil war. According to the interim government in Damascus, northeastern Syria has been largely excluded from the electoral process for security reasons. Negotiations are supposed to lead to the integration of this Kurdish-dominated region into the rest of Syria, but in the absence of significant progress, the standoff continues. In Raqqa, Kurdish authorities prepare for any eventuality.

ai_summary: Syria is holding its first parliamentary elections since the fall of Assad.
The elections are a step towards democratic polls.
Members of local committees will select a transitional parliament.
The process is criticized as biased.
Northeastern Syria has been largely excluded from the electoral process.

clusters.title: Georgia protesters try to storm Tbilisi presidential palace
clusters.neutral_headline: Georgia Protests Lead to Crackdown and Accusations
bullet_summary: Reported by BBC World, France24, Guardian World

items.title: Georgia protesters try to storm Tbilisi presidential palace
items.standfirst: Police used pepper spray to disperse demonstrators amid growing turmoil in the Caucasus country.
items.content: Police used pepper spray to disperse demonstrators amid growing turmoil in the Caucasus country.

items.title: Georgian PM vows crackdown on opposition after protests, accuses EU of meddling
items.standfirst: Georgia's Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze vowed opposition arrests Sunday (October 5) after police used pepper spray and water cannons against opposition protesters who tried to enter the presidential palace in what he termed was a coup bid during a controversial election. Georgian riot police detained five activists on Saturday, as the opposition staged a large demonstration on a day of local elections.
items.content: Georgia's Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze vowed opposition arrests Sunday (October 5) after police used pepper spray and water cannons against opposition protesters who tried to enter the presidential palace in what he termed was a coup bid during a controversial election. Georgian riot police detained five activists on Saturday, as the opposition staged a large demonstration on a day of local elections.

items.title: Georgia’s prime minister announces crackdown on dissent after Tbilisi protests
items.standfirst: Irakli Kobakhidze accused EU ambassador of supporting ‘attempt to overthrow constitutional order’ Georgia’s prime minister, Irakli Kobakhidze, has announced a sweeping crackdown on dissent, accusing demonstrators who tried to storm the presidential palace of aiming to topple his government and blaming the European Union for interference in his country.Kobakhidze levelled his allegations a day after protesters attempted to breach the presidential palace as local elections were being held. They were stopped by riot police using pepper spray and water cannon. Continue reading...
items.content: Irakli Kobakhidze accused EU ambassador of supporting ‘attempt to overthrow constitutional order’ Georgia’s prime minister, Irakli Kobakhidze, has announced a sweeping crackdown on dissent, accusing demonstrators who tried to storm the presidential palace of aiming to topple his government and blaming the European Union for interference in his country.Kobakhidze levelled his allegations a day after protesters attempted to breach the presidential palace as local elections were being held. They were stopped by riot police using pepper spray and water cannon. Continue reading...

items.title: Georgian PM vows crackdown on opposition after protests, accuses EU of meddling
items.standfirst: Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze said that up to 7,000 people attended a rally on Saturday, in a failed "attempt to overthrow the constitutional order" which he alleged was supported by the European Union. Kobakhidze vowed opposition arrests on Sunday, adding that they "will no longer be allowed to be active in Georgian politics".
items.content: Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze said that up to 7,000 people attended a rally on Saturday, in a failed "attempt to overthrow the constitutional order" which he alleged was supported by the European Union. Kobakhidze vowed opposition arrests on Sunday, adding that they "will no longer be allowed to be active in Georgian politics".

ai_summary: Police used pepper spray to disperse protesters in Georgia.
The Prime Minister vowed arrests after the protests.
The Prime Minister accused the EU of meddling.
Protesters tried to enter the presidential palace.
The Prime Minister said the attempt was to overthrow the government.

clusters.title: Russia says it downed 251 Ukraine drones overnight, including one heading towards Moscow
clusters.neutral_headline: Russia Claims to Down Hundreds of Ukrainian Drones
bullet_summary: Russia's defence ministry said on Monday that it had intercepted 251 Ukrainian drones overnight, one of Kyiv's largest retaliatory attacks in over three years of war with its neighbour
Most of the drones were downed over the southwest, the ministry said, while one was destroyed as it headed for the Russian capital
Russia's Ministry of Defense announced on Monday that its air defense forces intercepted 251 Ukrainian drones overnight, according to a post on Telegram

items.title: Russia says it downed 251 Ukraine drones overnight, including one heading towards Moscow
items.standfirst: Russia's defence ministry said on Monday that it had intercepted 251 Ukrainian drones overnight, one of Kyiv's largest retaliatory attacks in over three years of war with its neighbour. Most of the drones were downed over the southwest, the ministry said, while one was destroyed as it headed for the Russian capital.
items.content: Russia's defence ministry said on Monday that it had intercepted 251 Ukrainian drones overnight, one of Kyiv's largest retaliatory attacks in over three years of war with its neighbour. Most of the drones were downed over the southwest, the ministry said, while one was destroyed as it headed for the Russian capital.

items.standfirst: Russia's Ministry of Defense announced on Monday that its air defense forces intercepted 251 Ukrainian drones overnight, according to a post on Telegram. Over Crimea, air defenses shot down 40 drones,...
items.content: Russia's Ministry of Defense announced on Monday that its air defense forces intercepted 251 Ukrainian drones overnight, according to a post on Telegram. Over Crimea, air defenses shot down 40 drones,...

ai_summary: Russia said it downed 251 Ukrainian drones overnight.
The drones were part of one of Kyiv's largest attacks.

One drone was destroyed heading for Moscow.
Russia's air defense forces intercepted the drones.

items.title: Mark Sanchez facing multiple charges after allegedly attacking truck driver, getting stabbed
items.standfirst: Court documents say former NFL quarterback Mark Sanchez attacked a 69-year-old truck driver for blocking a parking space in Indianapolis early Saturday morning. The driver told police he thought Sanchez was trying to kill him, so he stabbed Sanchez in self defense. Sanchez is hospitalized and charged with battery, intoxication and unlawful entry to a vehicle.

clusters.title: France Live: New government under PM Sébastian Lecornu already facing criticism

items.title: France Live: New government under PM Sébastian Lecornu already facing criticism
items.standfirst: French Prime Minister Sébastian Lecornu named a new government full of familiar faces on Sunday as he struggles to pull the country out of a political crisis. The new cabinet lineup was unveiled nearly a month after President Emmanuel Macron appointed Lecornu, who risks being toppled by the opposition in a deeply divided parliament. Follow our liveblog for updates.
items.content: French Prime Minister Sébastian Lecornu named a new government full of familiar faces on Sunday as he struggles to pull the country out of a political crisis. The new cabinet lineup was unveiled nearly a month after President Emmanuel Macron appointed Lecornu, who risks being toppled by the opposition in a deeply divided parliament. Follow our liveblog for updates.

items.title: Macron appoints new French government in attempt to end political deadlock
items.standfirst: Rivals say president’s latest cabinet represents unwelcome continuity and hard-left party vows to file no-confidence motion amid fraught budget talksFrench president Emmanuel Macron has named a new government as he struggles to pull the country out of a political crisis, while rivals threatened to topple the lineup quickly if it failed to break with Macron’s past policies.The new cabinet was unveiled nearly a month after the appointment of prime minister Sebastien Lecornu, who sought to obtain cross-party support in a deeply divided parliament. Continue reading...
items.content: Rivals say president’s latest cabinet represents unwelcome continuity and hard-left party vows to file no-confidence motion amid fraught budget talksFrench president Emmanuel Macron has named a new government as he struggles to pull the country out of a political crisis, while rivals threatened to topple the lineup quickly if it failed to break with Macron’s past policies.The new cabinet was unveiled nearly a month after the appointment of prime minister Sebastien Lecornu, who sought to obtain cross-party support in a deeply divided parliament. items.title: France unveils new government led by Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu
items.standfirst: France’s new prime minister Sébastien Lecornu named a new government on Sunday, bringing back former finance minister Bruno Le Maire as the new defence minister, while other familiar faces, like Interior Minister Bruno Retailleau and Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot, will stay in their posts.
items.content: France’s new prime minister Sébastien Lecornu named a new government on Sunday, bringing back former finance minister Bruno Le Maire as the new defence minister, while other familiar faces, like Interior Minister Bruno Retailleau and Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot, will stay in their posts.

clusters.title: Andrej Babiš to hold talks with other Czech parties on forming government

Reported by Guardian World, BBC World

items.title: Andrej Babiš to hold talks with other Czech parties on forming government
items.standfirst: Billionaire faces tricky task trying to secure enough support to become PM after ANO wins elections without majorityAndrej Babiš has met the Czech president, Petr Pavel, and is to hold talks with other party leaders as the billionaire populist begins the tricky job of trying to form a stable government after his ANO (Yes) party won parliamentary elections, but failed to secure a majority.Final results showed ANO won 34.5% of the vote, held on Friday and Saturday, translating to a provisional 80 seats in the 200-member parliament. The centre-right Spolu coalition of the outgoing prime minister, Petr Fiala, came second on 23.4%. Continue reading...
items.content: Billionaire faces tricky task trying to secure enough support to become PM after ANO wins elections without majorityAndrej Babiš has met the Czech president, Petr Pavel, and is to hold talks with other party leaders as the billionaire populist begins the tricky job of trying to form a stable government after his ANO (Yes) party won parliamentary elections, but failed to secure a majority.Final results showed ANO won 34.5% of the vote, held on Friday and Saturday, translating to a provisional 80 seats in the 200-member parliament. The centre-right Spolu coalition of the outgoing prime minister, Petr Fiala, came second on 23.4%. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Andrej Babiš's ANO party won the Czech parliamentary election but lacked a majority.

The election results were finalized after voting on Friday and Saturday.
